skill.name: Senior QA
skill.description: Comprehensive QA and testing skill for quality assurance, test automation, and testing strategies for ReactJS, NextJS, NodeJS applications. Includes test suite generation, coverage analysis, E2E testing setup, and quality metrics. Use when designing test strategies, writing test cases, implementing test automation, performing manual testing, or analyzing test coverage.
skill.summary: Production-ready QA toolkit with automated test generation, coverage analysis, and E2E scaffolding for modern web applications.
skill.author: Claude Skills Team

security_audit.summary: All 58 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The scanner incorrectly flagged markdown documentation code blocks as shell commands, descriptive text as cryptographic algorithms, and standard file I/O as dangerous operations. This skill contains only legitimate QA documentation and Python CLI tools with no malicious code, network access, command execution, or cryptographic operations.

content.value_statement: Quality assurance requires significant time to design test strategies and maintain test suites. This skill provides automated test generation, coverage analysis, and E2E scaffolding to accelerate QA workflows while ensuring comprehensive test coverage for React, Next.js, and Node.js applications.
actual_capabilities: Generate comprehensive test suites for React, Next.js, and Node.js applications
Analyze code coverage and identify untested code paths requiring priority attention
Scaffold end-to-end test infrastructure with Playwright or Cypress frameworks
Provide QA best practices and testing strategy documentation
limitations: Does not execute tests or run test suites directly
Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines or testing services
Does not perform security testing or vulnerability scanning
Focuses on JavaScript and TypeScript applications

use_cases.title: Component Testing Setup
use_cases.description: Generate Jest and React Testing Library tests for new components with proper mocking patterns and edge case coverage.

use_cases.title: Coverage Analysis
use_cases.description: Analyze code coverage reports and identify critical untested code paths requiring additional test coverage.

use_cases.title: Test Strategy Design
use_cases.description: Design comprehensive testing strategies including unit, integration, and E2E test distributions with coverage targets.

prompt_templates.title: Generate Component Tests
prompt_templates.scenario: Create tests for a React component
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the senior-qa skill to generate unit tests for my React component at [file-path]. Include tests for all props, state changes, and user interactions.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze Coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the coverage analyzer on my project at [directory-path] and identify the top 5 code paths with lowest coverage that should be prioritized for testing.

prompt_templates.title: Setup E2E Framework
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the senior-qa skill to scaffold an E2E testing setup using Playwright for my Next.js application at [project-path]. Include page object patterns and custom commands.

prompt_templates.title: Design Test Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my Node.js API at [project-path] and design a testing strategy that covers unit tests, integration tests, and contract tests with appropriate coverage targets.

output_examples.input: Generate tests for my React button component with variants and disabled states
output: Missing coverage: disabled interaction state on mobile Safari
Recommendation: Add integration test for keyboard navigation with screen reader

output_examples.input: Analyze coverage for my Next.js dashboard
output: Low coverage areas: error handling (34%), auth middleware (45%), analytics tracking (51%)
Priority fix: Error boundary components missing fallback tests
Suggestion: Add integration tests for authentication flow covering token refresh scenarios

best_practices: Use the test pyramid: more unit tests at the base, fewer integration tests, minimal E2E tests at the top
Aim for 80% code coverage on critical business logic paths while avoiding coverage metrics on boilerplate code
Generate tests early in development to catch bugs before they reach production and reduce debugging time
anti_patterns: Avoid 100% coverage targets as they encourage testing trivial code over meaningful scenarios
Do not rely solely on E2E tests as they are slow to run and brittle to maintain
Avoid testing implementation details that change frequently; focus on observable behavior and user outcomes

faq.question: What frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: Jest, React Testing Library, Playwright, Cypress, and Vitest for modern JavaScript and TypeScript applications.

faq.question: Does this skill run tests automatically?
faq.answer: No, the skill generates test files and provides analysis. Users run tests using their project's test runner.

faq.question: Can I customize test templates?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill uses configurable templates that can be modified in the scripts directory for project-specific patterns.

faq.question: What coverage metrics does it analyze?
faq.answer: Line coverage, branch coverage, function coverage, and statement coverage from standard coverage reporters.

faq.question: Does it work with monorepos?
faq.answer: Yes, point the tool to specific package directories within the monorepo structure for targeted analysis.

faq.question: Can this skill test API endpoints?
faq.answer: It generates integration tests for API endpoints. For runtime testing, use a tool like Supertest or Postman.
